channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Robert L. Stirm, Returning P.O.W. in Pulitzer-Winning Photo, Dies at 92
item.description: The image immortalized a Vietnam veteran’s joyous homecoming to his beaming family but hid the painful truth about a marriage that was about to end.

item.title: Nvidia says it has ‘visibility to a half a trillion dollars’ in revenue through 2026. That would make it one of America’s biggest companies
item.description: Nvidia, the AI chipmaker led by Jensen Huang, is on track to crack the top 10 of the Fortune 500.

item.title: AI’s power and water consumption is worrying the agriculture sector: ‘Don’t forget that it is also required for us to grow food’
item.description: “Don't forget the humans in the equation," warned Gerard Lim, CEO of vertical farm startup Agroz at the Fortune Innovation Forum.

item.title: Florida Lawmaker Stole FEMA Funds for House Campaign, Prosecutors Say
item.description: Representative Sheila Cherfilus-McCormick misused $5 million in Covid-related funds during the pandemic in part to finance her campaign, according to ...

item.title: Jensen Huang pours cold water on an AI bubble, and says ‘Nvidia is unlike any other accelerator’ in the boom
item.description: The world is undergoing three massive platform shifts at once, the CEO said, as the stock soared more than 6% in after-hours trading.

item.title: Larry Summers to Stop Teaching at Harvard While It Investigates His Epstein Ties
item.description: The former Harvard president had previously stepped down from other positions following revelations about his longtime connections to Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Saudi Arabia, Once Shunned, Has Corporate Titans Swooning for Deals
item.description: Some of the most prominent U.S. executives gathered at the Kennedy Center for an event promoting deal-making with the oil-rich kingdom.

item.title: Trump and Mamdani Will Meet at White House on Friday
item.description: The meeting between Zohran Mamdani, the mayor-elect of New York City, and President Trump will come after the two men have fiercely attacked one anoth...

item.title: Alberta Invokes Last-Resort Constitutional Clause to Shield Trans Laws From Challenges
item.description: The western province’s conservative government has invoked a rarely used clause in Canada’s Constitution to shield its bills limiting transgender righ...

item.title: Mexico Is Now the United States’ Top Buyer
item.description: For first time in at least 30 years, the United States has exported more to Mexico than Canada, U.S. government data show, in a sign of how much North...

item.title: Climate Change Is Stressing Italy’s Cows, and Coming for Your Burrata
item.description: Extreme heat causes cows to produce less milk. This poses problems in cheese-obsessed Italy, especially as it tries to meet growing demand for favorit...

item.title: Nvidia blows past revenue targets and forecasts trillions in AI infrastructure spending by end of decade
item.description: Strong revenue and “off-the-charts” GPU demand show Nvidia’s AI engine still roaring as CEO Jensen Huang delivers a beat-and-raise quarter

item.title: Panera’s CEO unveiled a comeback plan—and it includes better ingredients like lettuce: ‘No one likes iceberg’
item.description: Panera, once considered the gold standard in American fast-casual dining, has fallen behind competitors like Chipotle and Panda Express.

item.title: Police Found $1 Million in a Tub Under a Garage. The Government Gets to Keep It.
item.description: A court ruled that the hidden cash, which the police found while searching for an illegal gun in Ontario, did not lawfully belong to the man living on...

item.title: F.B.I. Hunt Intensifies for Ryan Wedding, Snowboarder Accused of Being a Drug Kingpin
item.description: Ryan Wedding, a former Olympic athlete said to be a major cocaine trafficker, is accused of ordering the murder of a witness who was set to testify ag...
